diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute Necrotic Pancreatitis, Ethanol Withdrawal, Alcohol Use Disorder
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute onset of severe epigastric abdominal pain and emesis after a period of alcohol consumption. Key laboratory findings included an elevated lactate level that improved with intravenous fluids, supporting the diagnosis of acute pancreatitis. The clinical history of alcohol use coupled with the acute symptoms also suggested ethanol withdrawal.
